document_data.name: Eccles Cake
document_data.mainbody: '''Eccles cakes''' were sweet and fruity handfoods from the hamlet of [[Liam's Hold]].
document_data.Description: Eccles cakes were a type of small delectable pastry stuffed with mincemeats and dried fruits. They traditionally were eaten during the cold months of the year accompanied by a glass of hot [[mulled wine]].
document_data.Availability: These small cakes were a staple of [[Nell's Pie Shop]] of Liam's Hold ''circa'' [[1372 DR]].
